greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of strict permutations of the prime indices of n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
Also the number of (1,1)-avoiding permutations of the prime indices of n.
link: Gus Wiseman, Sequences counting and ranking compositions by the patterns they match or avoid.
formula: If n is squarefree, a(n) = A001221(n)!; otherwise a(n) = 0.
xref: Positions of first appearances are A002110 with 2 replaced by 4.
Permutations of prime indices are counted by A008480.
Anti-run permutations of prime indices are counted by A335452.
(1,1,1)-avoiding permutations of prime indices are counted by A335511.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jun 19 2020
